snippet: On his first trip to the Middle East since being elected, Mayor Bill de Blasio was careful in his remarks on recent violence in the region, saying that his visit coincided with “a very painful reality.”
abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio listens to Israelis and Palestinians discuss regional tensions during conference with parents, students and faculty of Jerusalem school, unusual for educating Jewish and Arab children together; de Blasio avoids specific questions on conflict at meeting, his first to Middle East since he became mayor, but denounces attacks on innocent civilians as morally wrong and eroding overall sense of security.
lead_paragraph: On his first trip to the Middle East since being elected, Mayor Bill de Blasio was careful in his remarks on recent violence in the region, saying that his visit coincided with “a very painful reality.”

headline.main: Mayor de Blasio, Visiting Jerusalem, Hears From All Sides of Region’s Conflict
headline.print_headline: De Blasio, in First Visit to Jerusalem as Mayor, Hears From 2 Sides in Strife
